attributes.action: Re-open Abingdon Airfield in Oxfordshire for Civil Flying
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
RAF Abingdon was a Royal Air Force station near Abingdon, Oxfordshire.

The base was opened in 1932, initially as a training station for RAF Bomber Command. It continued in this role through World War II.
The station was closed in December 1992. It was taken over by the British Army and renamed Dalton Barracks.

I would like to see the Airfield Re-opened for Civil FLights. This wold be very popular with Aviation Enthusiasts all over the country and it would be a real boost to the local area and economy. It would also be a boost to tourism in Abingdon and Oxford.

The Airfield has a lot of history and it really would be a good thing to bring flying back to the site
